{"step_by_step_thinking": "The cornea is a part of the eye and its sensory supply would be provided by a nerve related to the eye. The infraorbital, supraorbital, and infratrochlear nerves are all related to the eye, but they primarily supply areas around the eye, not the cornea itself. The nasociliary nerve, despite the probable printing mistake in the question, is a branch of the ophthalmic division of the trigeminal nerve and it gives off the long ciliary nerves which supply the cornea as mentioned in Document 1.", "answer_choice": "D"}
